meanings.definition: Lacking in quantity or quality; insufficient.
meanings.sent1: The meagre portions of food left him hungry.
meanings.sent2: The meagre light in the room made it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: His meagre attempt at a joke fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The meagre support from his friends left him feeling alone.
meanings.sent5: The meagre salary barely covered his expenses.

meanings.definition: Thin or lean in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: Her meagre frame made her appear fragile.
meanings.sent2: The meagre crowd at the event surprised the organizers.
meanings.sent3: The meagre thread barely held the fabric together.
meanings.sent4: The meagre chances of success motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The meagre resources limited their options.

meanings.sent1: The meagre information provided little insight.
meanings.sent2: His meagre excuses did not convince anyone.
meanings.sent3: The meagre supply of water made showering a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The meagre results of the experiment were disappointing.
meanings.sent5: The meagre knowledge on the subject hindered their progress.
